[/quote]
He’s trying to copy McDonald’s idea of selling Ethiopian food.[/quote]

There’s food in Ethiopia? Since when?

item.title: Please tell me what you think of my Order Process - UPDATED WITH MYSQL
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Wrauld, post:34, topic:248119”][quote author=FastBawlz link=topic=327154.msg2564780#msg2564780 date=1228342450]

This has to be said - why are you selling programming services when you do not know how to do what you are selling?

This is an example, I know php well enough now, I know Visual Basic well, I know html well, so the only thing I don’t know very good is php. Which I’m already doing MySQL

From the examples you’ve shown, you don’t know nearly enough to be considered a professional in any of these fields.

PHP and MYSQL yes
anything else im fine.

Fine != Professional

Try to learn good at one language before moving on to another?
[/quote]
Agreed. I went from: Html to Design(Photoshop…etc,.) to Css to Php within 2 years (started php this week) , take your time, all I’m seeing that you are C + P from tizag.com…

Try taking your time, the world is not going to blow up tomorrow…[/quote]

The only script I coped and pasted was the first one, the one I’ve posted. The rest is stuff I’ve learned.

Im taking a class at school on html, it doesn’t take that long, I learned html before we even started, I have a 99 in that class.

Mopman:

OK then, I assumed this was going to be a production website and you were going to sell these services. If not then of course theres no reason to have “fits”.

And no, I’m going to make a new design.

Read full topic

PHP and MYSQL yes
anything else im fine.

Fine != Professional

Try to learn good at one language before moving on to another?[/quote]

Try taking your time, the world is not going to blow up tomorrow…

item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:26, topic:248119”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=327154.msg2564792#msg2564792 date=1228342626]
HTML != Programming Language

FastBawlz == FailedPost
[/quote]

Apparently you don’t know what HTML stand for, eh?

Who said I said that you said you were professional?

I guess you should learn English before another language.
inb4 irony.[/quote]

You implied it by saying Fine != Professional, maybe you should learn logic.

Mopman:

But uh - you are selling PHP programming services?

Im not really selling anything, this is just for practice.

And uhh…calling me a scammer, I never said im going to bill your credit card, I never asked for paypal email. So\ namely, your wrong. no offense.

EDIT: I removed the PHP Programming Option, so you don’t have any more fits.

item.source: Please tell me what you think of my Order Process - UPDATED WITH MYSQL

item.title: Please tell me what you think of my Order Process - UPDATED WITH MYSQL
item.dc:creator: @I_james_I I james I
item.description:
@I_james_I wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:1, topic:248119”]UPDATE: Ive added http://www.wiebelhausdesign.com/names.php Ive added a place where I can see what people have entered so I dont have to do a script to email myself, obviosuly I will password protect it. Please test my mysql injection, I need to make sure it works. Obviously this is going to be funny because people are going to type some weird shit into it. Just use order.php and go to names.php. Please tell me if it works.

I have finished most of my site, I just converter it to php, if you want to mean what I mean by converted I mean I made certain objects separate like navigation.php so all i had to do was require it to show which will allow me to change it and it will effect all the pages.

I want everyone to test out the Order Link, its basic, doesn’t send me an email so don’t worry, I haven’t got that far, it just says it did.

http://wiebelhausdesign.com/

Please test it and tell me your thoughts.

No comments about rounded edges please.

Here is my code for process.php

Ty wraud for the safe_output function

[code]

<?php $servicetype = $_POST['servicetype']; $name = $_POST['name']; $email = $_POST['email']; function safe_output($string) { $string = trim($string); $string = strip_tags($string); $string = htmlspecialchars($string); return $string; } echo "Thank you " .safe_output($name). " for inquring about ".safe_output($servicetype)."
an email has been sent to ".safe_output($email)."
and I will email you back as soon so possible."; ?>[/code][/quote]

Nice try and make the contact form so that if someone leaves a field blank, it wont submit.

Read full topic

item.title: Please tell me what you think of my Order Process - UPDATED WITH MYSQL
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“Wrauld, post:15, topic:248119”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=327154.msg2562500#msg2562500 date=1228216376]
Alright sounds good, ill try doing that after school, I stopped at functions lol but they make sense to me, I just don’t want to use atm. Ill probably use wrauds thought so I don’t have to keep typing the same thing over and over again.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2008, 05:40:00 am[/size][hr][quote author=Wrauld link=topic=327154.msg2562040#msg2562040 date=1228185493]
I’d recommend some security because i can change the boldness in your text on your website…

http://www.phpvideotutorials.com/app/webroot/lesson09/

If I was you, I’d watch that.

fuctoin safe_output($string) {
    $string = trim($string);
    $string = strip_tags($string);
    $string = htmlspecialchars($string);

       return $string;
}

you would add that
[/quote]

Thank you for this wraud.
[/quote]
no probelm ;)[/quote]

Im already on mysql lmao… its easier than Visual Basic, ive already finished my anti-mysql injection, pretty simple. Tizag is awesome, I did miss the section about htmlentites lmao.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2008, 07:17:56 pm[/size][hr]UPDATED WITH MYSQL[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 02, 2008, 09:43:32 pm[/size][hr]I guess this means someone failed lmao

document.write(document.cookie); - vb - Test Three - vb - testthree@wiebelhausdesign.com ' \ - vb -
